Pre-Game Insights: The match was the final group stage game for both New Zealand and Sri Lanka in the ICC Men's ODI World Cup 2023.New Zealand had previously lost to Pakistan in their most recent match, despite scoring 401 runs.Sri Lanka had a high-scoring match against Bangladesh, with Charith Asalanka scoring 108 runs.The pitch in Bengaluru was expected to favor batting, with the average first innings score being 320 runs.New Zealand's possible playing XI included Devon Conway, Rachin Ravindra, Kane Williamson, and others.Sri Lanka's possible playing XI included Pathum Nissanka, Kusal Perera, Kusal Mendis, and others.The match was available to watch on Disney+ Hotstar and Star Sports Network.
